reason: NO_RULE - insufficient evidence or no valid constraint found
notes: The evidence provided does not establish any explicit normative constraint or mathematical relationship between freqDomainPosition and freqDomainShift. The description is purely definitional.

meta.evidence: - Defining partial frequency sounding factor and start RB index for partial frequency sounding as defined by the higher layer parameters FreqScalingFactor \mathrm{P}_{\mathrm{F}} and StartRBIndex k_{\mathrm{F}} , respectively, and described in Clause 6.4.1.4 of [4, TS 38.211]. If not configured, then P_{F}=1 and k_{F}=0 . - Defining start RB index hopping for partial frequency sounding in different SRS frequency hopping periods for aperiodic/periodic/semi-persistent SRS based on the hopping pattern k_{\text {hopping }} as described in clause 6.4.1.4.3 in [4, TS 38.211. If not configured, then start RB hopping is not enabled and k_{\text {hoppng }} is fixed to be 0 for all SRS symbols. - Defining frequency domain position and configurable shift, as defined by the higher layer parameters freqDomainPosition and freqDomainShift, respectively, and described in clause 6.4.1.4 of [4, TS 38.211]. If freqDomainPosition is not configured, freqDomainPosition is zero. - Cyclic shift, as defined by the higher layer parameter cyclicShift-n2, cyclicShift-n4, or cyclicShift-n8 for transmission comb value 2, 4 or 8, and described in clause 6.4.1.4 of [4, TS 38.211]. - Transmission comb value, as defined by the higher layer parameter transmission Comb described in clause 6.4.1.4 of [4, TS 38.211].
